newsitem.title: USA: Vantive lands big Fedex project.
newsitem.headline: Vantive lands big Fedex project.

text.p: Vantive Corp said Friday that Federal Express Corp will use its help-desk software for a key customer service-project -- a potentially huge source of revenue for Vantive.
Terms of the transaction were not disclosed.

Federal Express, the Memphis-based package delivery company, will initially use Vantive's software to set up an internal computer system that lets technicians keep track of internal Fedex troubleshooting projects, the companies said.
Federal Express then will use Vantive's products to set up a help desk that will let the customer service department support Fedex shipping terminals at customer's sites.
Fedex potentially could deploy Vantive software to 60,000 of its employees within three years, said Jim Colson, Fedex's vice president of technology services.
Since Vantive gets a fee up to several thousand dollars for every workstation, the agreement with Federal Express could be a huge source of revenue, analysts said.
"It will be a significant deal for Vantive, definately," said Ed Bierdeman, analyst at Dakin Securities in San Francisco.

Vantive, based in Santa Clara, Calif, writes computer programs that help companies improve their customer service departments. Its Vantive Support product lets technicians log and track customer calls.
Depending on each project, Vantive gets about $30,000 for the central piece of its software and about $2,500 for every user.
